title: 111_hr4980
content: The "Kick OPIC Act of 2010" terminates the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The "Kick OPIC Act of 2010" terminates the Overseas Private Investment Corporation's authority to issue new obligations and terminates OPIC itself after a 180-day period. Existing contracts and agreements are preserved. The "Kick OPIC Act of 2010" abolishes the Overseas Private Investment Corporation after a 180-day period. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will take over OPIC's functions with existing contracts until they expire, and then wind up the Corporation's affairs. Title IV of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is repealed but still applies. The "Kick OPIC Act of 2010" abolishes the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, transferring its funds to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget for use in performing OPIC's functions until existing contracts expire. Any unexpended balances will be deposited in the Treasury. SEC. 3. SAVINGS PROVISIONS. Prior determinations, regulations, and contracts issued before the repeal shall remain in effect until modified or revoked by authorized officials or through legal processes. The repeal will not affect pending proceedings on the effective date. The proposed rulemaking, pending on the effective date of the repeal, will continue for Overseas Private Investment Corporation functions. Orders issued in these proceedings will remain in effect until modified or revoked by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget can revoke or modify proceedings, and regulations for transfer of proceedings can be issued. Actions are subject to exceptions outlined in subsection (e). The provisions of the Act do not affect ongoing suits, and proceedings will continue as if the Act had not been enacted. Liabilities and actions involving the Overseas Private Investment Corporation will not be affected by the Act's enactment. (e) Parties involved in suits with the Overseas Private Investment Corporation before the repeal will have the Director of the Office of Management and Budget substituted or added as a party. (f) Orders and actions by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget in place of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation will be subject to judicial review as if issued by the Corporation, following the same statutory requirements. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Title 5, United States Code is amended by removing specific positions at the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Additionally, amendments are made to the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 by repealing certain sections. Amendments are made to various sections of different acts, including the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Export Enhancement Act of 1988, by striking and redesignating subsections and paragraphs. Amendments are made to different sections of acts by striking and redesignating paragraphs and clauses. Amendments to various sections of different acts involve striking and redesignating clauses and paragraphs. Amendments to various sections of different acts involve repealing specific provisions and sections. The amendments and repeals made by this section will take effect after a 180-day period from the enactment of the Act.
